1. "The Conjuring" - This movie follows paranormal investigators who help families deal with unexplained supernatural phenomena.

2. "Get Out" - This movie tells the story of a young black man named Chris who goes to visit his wealthy white girlfriend, Rachel.

3. "Hereditary" - This movie tells the story of the Wilson family, which has been plagued by mysterious illnesses and deaths for generations.

I hope these recommendations are helpful in finding movies within the horror genre that might interest you.

1. "The Conjuring" (2014) - Directed by Ron Howard and based on the novel of the same name, this supernatural horror film revolves around paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren, who travel to a rural New England community to investigate strange occurrences.
2. "Get Out" (2017) - Directed by Jordan Peele and starring Chris Pine, Emma Stone, and Will Smith, this psychological horror film centers on a young black man named Chris, who goes on a weekend getaway with his white girlfriend, Rachel.
As you can see from the recommendations I provided earlier, both "The Conjuring" (2014) and "Get Out" (2017) are highly acclaimed supernatural horror films.

Based on their interest in thriller movies, I would recommend the following two movies:

1. "Gone Girl" (2014): This movie tells a gripping story about a woman named Amy who goes missing from her home. The police arrive at the scene of Amy's disappearance, and they begin to investigate the case.

As the investigation unfolds, it becomes clear that Amy is not what she appears to be. As the true nature of Amy is revealed, it becomes clear that this case will have a shocking ending.

2. "No Country for Old Men" (2007): This movie tells a gripping story about two men named George and Lenny who go on a journey through the mountains in the United States. As they travel through the mountains, they encounter several dangerous situations, including a chase through the mountains by a group of men hired to kill George.

As the investigation unfolds, it becomes clear that this case will have a shocking ending.

Overall, both "Gone Girl" and "No Country for Old Men" are highly recommended movies from the thriller genre.
